sqeuclidean.answer: Gastroparesis would be unlikely with a negative gastric emptying scan.At this time, an upper endoscopy would further evaluate the upper digestive tract.The CT scan would make liver or gallbladder disease less likely.  If the upper endoscopy is negative, you can consider more specialized tests like a 24-hr pH study ( to exclude GERD) or an esophageal motility study.These options can be discussed with your personal gastroenterologist, preferably at an academic medical center.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.www.kevinmd.com

My mother has gastroparesis and has been dealing with it for 3 years this December. My mother goes to John Hopkins. My mother has had two emptying test done. First study should it took her more than 12hrs to empty. 2nd test was done one day after she had Botox injected to the openng of her stomach to her small intestines. It should great improvement, but it is not always sucessful for everybody and only last for about 6months before wearing off. My moms only lasted for about 3months. My mom lives off off hot tea's, toast, very little cereal. Before the injections my mom vomitted daily for hours at time.  She cannot even tolerate the smell of food without being sick. Its very hard on her and the family not to be able to have holiday dinners or to go out to lunch. My mother also has Type 1 Diabetes, unfortunately this can be common for those who have diabetes. There is a world superior doctor at Temple University in Philly who specializes in mobility problems of the stomach. Maybe you could try there.
